title: Multi-User Online Simulation-Based Education for Solving Complex and Unstructured Problems

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level domain knowledge in professional fields (medical/legal/technical) and basic problem-solving experience
context.additional_context: Collaborative problem-solving environment using digital devices, designed around complex social domain cases (e.g., medical ethics dilemmas, technology policy conflicts)

learning_goals: Learners can analyze causal relationships in complex problems and derive core elements with 80% accuracy.
Learners can propose three or more actionable solutions to unstructured problems by applying an interdisciplinary approach.
Learners can iteratively improve problem-solving strategies through collaboration with peers and achieve 4 or higher on a 5-point scale in formative assessments.

resources: Massive Multiplayer Online Game Platform License
Digital Collaboration Tools (Real-Time Document Editing, Whiteboard)
Problem-solving process documentation and analysis software

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
